Reviews.Title: “This place was dirty, in disrepair and the staff was rude.”
Reviews.Author: pdxbeka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night at the end of our trip to be near the airport. Big mistake! Since we have a child and a baby we asked for a room on the first floor that was easy to access with all of our luggage and gear we had to haul. The woman at the desk was very rude to my husband and she then put us on the top floor all the way on the back of the building. We couldn't even park near the door due to some trailers blocking half of the parking lot. Our room was really gross and outdated. Stay away from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: HomeGirl2
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the front desk person made rude comments about other guests to us. There was leftover food from the previous guest in the mini-fridge. The one ice machine for the entire hotel was on the opposite side of the building in the laundry room. The bathroom was carpeted....with very dirty carpeting. The key card did not work for the fitness center room so the same front desk person told me to go to the restaurant and call maintenance to get the lock fixed! I don't know. I guess I just didn't feel this was in my job description at $250 a night. I did it anyway. After finally just running outside because I couldn't reach maintenance, I stopped by the front desk to charge a water to my room and the same front desk person said she was busy and to come back later. There was not one guest at the desk besides me. The pool was closed for 4 hours on a Saturday for a baby's first birthday party! I give this hotel one star for the SPECTACULAR VIEW we woke up to. After all, it IS Maui!

Reviews.Title: “For the price, it's not bad.”
Reviews.Author: gittinsj
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure whether to stay at this hotel based on some of the reviews, but I don't think it is as bad as some people have made it out. It was by no means the worst hotel I have stayed it, but it was neither the best. The good things: I think that the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. During one check-in, they allowed me to check in early without any fuss, and I really appreciated that. The parking is free (which is not the case for the other hotel nearby), as is the wired internet. The view from parts of the hotel is not that bad, either. You can get a pretty good view of the harbor. Finally, based on the price ($60 to $70 less expensive than most other hotels, at a minimum), it wasn't disappointing. I'm sure if I had paid $200-300 per room instead, that it might be better. The bad things: There aren't a whole lot of amazing view or beaches right nearby, though the scenery around was still impressive. The rooms seemed older, and one of the two rooms I had didn't seem as clean. It was a handicapped room, and because of the way the shower was built, water does flow toward the carpet in the room, and I believe that does cause some moldy smell to build up. But it was in no means the worse, again. It does tend to detract from the overall stay, though. The moral of the story: If you're looking for a fancy place to stay, expect to pay more and stay somewhere else!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A practical choice for overnight”
Reviews.Author: wordsofwisdom
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, convenient. Not a destination in itself, but near the airport and everything you need to buy before heading out to where you really want to go; try it if you're flying in late, or flying out early. It does have an attractive courtyard and sandy/rocky strip of beach that's nice enough for a stroll, watching the sunrise light up the West Maui Mountains and big ships come into Kahului Harbor as canoes paddle out. The staff were courteous and helpful, but didn't tell us that if you want free breakfast you have to get a ticket when you check in. The room was fairly small, and the pool hours very limited (9-5). Internet access in the room and the lobby was pathetically slow; the wireless connection was actually better when I took my laptop out to the edge of the grass overlooking the water. I'd stay here again if my priorities were price, convenience, privacy and a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Sandra M
Reviews.Content: The room was an adequate size and clean and we were there for the last 5 nights of our vacation. Next time we'd only stay for a night or two. They do not provide coffee machines in the rooms...what's that about. If I'd known that I'd have bought a cheap coffeemaker at Walmart...would have cost me less. I wake up very early (o.k. that's my problem) but to have to wait until 6:30 to get a coffee and pay $1.50 seems pretty ridiculous. I've only experienced that in Vegas where they want you to go to the casino. Coffee was included with the breakfast but I had to wait until my friend wanted to go for breakfast or pay. The breakfast we included in our room rate was good but the Friday/Saturday night buffet was overpriced. You also get charged for using the telephone even if you are calling a 1-800 number. For food cross over to the Mall and try the food court or better yet go to Casanova's across from the Maui Seaside. Make a reservation as it seems to be very popular. Great Italian food, onion soup is spectacular and $5.00 for a carafe of Marguerita during happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: TooFarNorth
Reviews.Content: We felt like we really got lucky with this hotel. The breakfast that was included was actually good. Lots of fresh papaya and pineapple. There was always bacon and some kind of sausage (german, or links or country - we saw them all!), scrambled eggs and wheat or white toast. They had cereal and juices. They even had waffles ... toaster waffles, but still ... The pool was attached to the restaurant, which I always find a little odd, but since we didn't use it, it was not relevant. We didn't rent a car so it was Very Convenient to have the bus hub at Queen Ka'ahumanu Center across the street. It would be nice to have a pedestrian entrance on that end, but it was only a minor inconvenience to walk to the driveway. The free shuttle to the airport was also a huge plus. It's clean and they even fulfilled a few special requests ... an extra towel in the shower for one. I appreciated that they remembered it every day! Our room overlooked the lawn and gazebo and since we were on the end, we even got a bit of a water view. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: jimwack
Reviews.Content: I didn't have very good expectations going in, due to the reviews. Stayed a couple of nights waiting for our condo in kihei to be ready. Hotel is old and needs a little updating. The pool was much better than I expected. It is situated where it gets sun all day. Lots of restaurants, whole foods, a mall and a movie theatre all a very short walk. Staff was friendly. I don't think I would stay there my whole vacation, but a great deal for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: MrNod
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and booked for one night as a sleepover before we moved over to Wailea - it was much better than expected - staff polite and helpful - room clean - ok it is what it is - but no complaints for one night or so - it's still Maui !!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall: an excellent hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Cyclopath43
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Maui Beach Resort, which is located across the street from a large shopping mall. My room, which was very clean, had a double bed, a writing desk and lamp, a flat screen TV, a telephone, a nice dresser with two large drawers, a safe, a refrigerator, a radio alarm clock, and a closet with many hangers and a long shelf. The bathroom was spotless. It had a bathtub with a shower, but I didnâ€™t like the soap dispensers because they were awkward to access, especially when taking a bath. I would have preferred separate tubes of soap, shampoo and body lotion (no body lotion was even provided). The room had a small balcony with a plastic chair; my room on the second floor overlooked the landscaped courtyard of the hotel. The room was equipped with free Internet if the guest(s) brought a computer, which I did. I really enjoyed having that small luxury, rather than having to go to the lobby and use WiFi there (also available for free). I ate frequently at this hotelâ€™s restaurant and found the food to be quite tasty and plentiful, especially for the price I paid for the hotel and all the meals there. Overall, I rather liked this hotel and would recommend it to TripAdvisor readers.

Reviews.Title: “As Expected...”
Reviews.Author: akabowers
Reviews.Content: It wasn't a great hotel... The courtyard is pleasant and it is beach front. The rooms were tiny, really tiny. Upgraded shower heads, moderate bed and clean room. Lobby left something to be desired. We included the breakfast in our room rate which I would recommend as the prices seemed high for the buffet. Nice spread, lots of options. Open style seating with pool view. Overall you pay for what you get and this is a good option for a close to the hotel airport at a rate you can choke down. We stayed one night...I wouldn't have wanted to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sure the rooms are getting smaller!”
Reviews.Author: station
Reviews.Content: Thiis is our 2nd stay at the Maui Beach Hotel. I'm sure the rooms have shrunk since our last visit. We were certainly squeezed in this time. This hotel has everything you need, but if you like a bit more space you might have to specifically request a larger room. The breakfast was really nice with plenty of options for all tastes. We bought the room and breakfast package through Expedia which was cheaper than buying the breakfast direct from the hotel (maybe that's why we got the tiny room this time!). We prefer to stay in Kahalui when in Maui, so the choice of hotels is limited, but the good bus service means you don't need a car to get to many of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “This may be a "Last Resort" when you have no choice.”
Reviews.Author: coachpate
Reviews.Content: The stay at the mMaui Beach Hotel may have been better than sleeping in the car, at at least there was a shower and close to a nice Shopping Center. The bed was hard, the highway was busy all night and it was hard to sleep; Getting up early and checking out was the high light of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “bad customer service oriented stuff”
Reviews.Author: rick M
Reviews.Content: I won't recommend to stay in this hotel unless no other choice and for one night only. I noticed, if there is an issue, they are ready to respond and win always. I asked the front desk lady a question and I received lame answers. No customer satisfaction oriented front desk nor even a smile when you go to the front desk. Simple hotel, a few miles from the airport and walking distance to the Maui mall but you have to rent a car or take the bus from the mall to go to all resorts and beaches. There are better options, do some work in the internet and for same money or little more but get better service and deals some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: JNB2YVR
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, we booked this hotel for an overnight stop after a very late arrival. The hotel is very conveniently located to OGG (maybe 5 minutes). Parking was easy and looked safe. Check-in quick and easy, the clerk was friendly even though it was midnight. As others have noted, the place is old and the hallways smell a bit funky, but we were pleasantly surprised by the room. It was spacious and nicely decorated with a clean, comfy bed. Carpets were clean. The bathroom was bright and clean - very nice actually. Shower over the bath with curtain. Nice fluffy white towels. Separate vanity area. The a/c was noisy, but we don't sleep with it on anyway. Most of all, it was quiet and allowed us a good night's sleep. We didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that. Check-out was quick and painless. All in all, not a bad choice for what we wanted. A note to the hotel: my GPS wanted to know if it was 170 E. Kaahumanu or 170 W. Kaahumanu. I didn't know because my receipt didn't specify. Well, I picked the wrong one so we circled for a while before finding it. It would be nice to have the exact address specified as many (if not most) of us are navigating by GPS these days.

Reviews.Title: “okay for a night, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: irishmama34
Reviews.Content: We chose this for a late night arrival at the airport. It's close to the airport and suited our needs (to fall into bed after over 18 hrs of air travel). The staff was friendly & helpful. The rooms are old & very dated, but clean enough. The room needed a good airing (it smelled like "a grandma's house that's been vacant for a while" according to our daughter), but we didn't think the windows opened so we used the window air-conditioner. The windows DO open (we discovered in the morning). We slept fine and awoke refreshed and ready to enjoy Maui. This was one of the cheapest hotels on Maui. I've stayed in nicer chains for half the price on the mainland, but welcome to Hawaii. The nice people make up for the dated digs. PS - Yes, they have free shuttle transportation to/from the airport, but not after 8:30 at night. So plan on a taxi to the hotel after 8:30 at night. We used their free shuttle to the car rental in the morning (the driver was a treat; my husband gave him a generous tip).

Reviews.Title: “okay for a quick stop”
Reviews.Author: Kristymarie902
Reviews.Content: This was a great stopover after arriving in Maui late evening...up and out quite early so didn't experience breakfast...okay fro a quick stop in. dated but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Allinmi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and it was close to airport. Right beside a mall for some last minute shopping. Has a poll if its really hot. But there are so many things to see in Maui, only stay here if you need a quick bed! And they have free transport to airport, one of the few places in Maui that does this.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Birder57
Reviews.Content: We stayed a few nights here, and I found the entire hotel very comfortable, very eye-appealing, and quiet. The hotel sits right at the edge of the Pacific ocean and has a comfortable bench near the beach where you can sit quietly and watch the waves. The breakfast buffet is excellent; unfortunately, the hotel is only open for dinner a few nights a week. This is too bad. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Their is an onsite, in-building laundry which was very much appreciated after we had spent a couple of days hiking up muddy mountain slopes. I found the room very pleasant and the bed quite comfortable. The hallways were wide and bright and the entire hotel very clean. The housekeeping staff was very polite and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “IT ISN'T THE NEWEST HOTEL BUT THE STAFF IS OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: GinnyZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here, one at the beginning of the trip and one at the end. The hotel itself isn't the newest facility, but it is comfortable and is at a great location. The back door is the Pacific Ocean. The front door is a mall. What more could you ask for? Their staff were the friendliest. They were all invested in making sure that we were comfortable, happy, new where things were. Their airport and mall shuttle staff were excellent. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stop over and that's it - breakfast good”
Reviews.Author: DHCDB
Reviews.Content: The most positive thing about this hotel was that the shower had decent pressure and that the petrol station was near by for late night snacks! Stayed after arriving on late flight from Vegas to OGG before drive to Hana in the morning. Hotel dated and bland. Rooms small with noisy AC - but thank God for the A/C. Pretty much no-frills but was to be expected really. Breakfsat was included and was quite good - hence the 3 stars as opposed to 2. In summation, close to airport, reasonable price, good breakfast and clean and tidy. Not the best place for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay in a filthy, bug infested dive then this might just be the hotel for you. Checked in ...and then out within 10 minutes...my health is worth more than saving a few bucks. The only thing that this hotel has going for it is it's name...should more accurately be names "Maui Dump"

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: jwmerrell
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a little older, but very clean, my room #120 had been renovated. It is on the water but no real beach, the is as small beach only a couple of minutes away. Internet was free. This a good hotel for people want a inexpensive place to stay. it is ccentally located and located in the main city in Maui, the mall is less than a mile away. Also has resturant and gym on site, free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one or two nights; don't expect anything great.”
Reviews.Author: kabbott84
Reviews.Content: I rate this hotel more like 2.5 stars. I had an accident on the way to Hana and had to come back to Kahului. We chose this hotel for the price and were able to get a room last minute for $153 per night. The rooms and hotel were dated and a bit on the small side. No free coffee in the rooms but there was a larger refrigerator and television with good cable. As I was put up with an injury, this worked for me. I forgot to check on whether there was free internet. The bed was on the softer side, which I like. Customer service here was actually pretty good. The did run out of pillows, somehow, but we got extra towels instead. (Placed the towel under the pillow, seemed to work ok). The bellhops were actually really nice and I confidently say they were eager to help us. Breakfast buffet was $10 and that seemed fair. Definitely not a deal but there were eggs, sausage, cereal, milk, etc. Dinner was on the expensive side for the weekend and we did not eat there. Da Kitchen, just down the road, was nice. Nothing fancy here friends, but if you need a place to stay before heading to the airport it might be worth it over the more expensive hotels over in Kaanapali or around the Kahului area.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Cammy044
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night to be close to the airport. This hotel was dated and the room smelled old and musty. It looked as though they tried to clean it but the smell was disgusting. We slept on top of our sheet sin our traveling clothes which was a good thing because we found a spot of dried blood on one of the sheets in the morning. Needless to say we chose not to shower before we left because the bottom of the shower looked stained with ground in dirt as well. I would have gladly paid more to stay in a decent hotel even if it was only for one night!

Reviews.Title: “No "Aloha Spirit" Here!”
Reviews.Author: LifeListNotComplete
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated? Really? Their definition of recently must be different than ours. It looked dirty and old. If this is the "finest hotel in Central Maui", I'd hate to see the worst one. There were roaches in the lobby, the room curtains had holes in them, the carpet looked dirty. They advertise their famous "Aloha spirit" but every time we had any needs they acted put out like we were bothering them. It's like they wanted us to check into our room and then leave them alone and not "bother" them. Even a simple request such as extra towels and a blanket was met with what seemed to be annoyance. IF YOU WANT TO USE THE INTERNET DURING YOUR VACATION--DON'T STAY HERE! There were issues with it **every** single time we tried to use it. They offer internet in the lobby for a fee, of course. And if you're a coffee drinker---you'll have to pay $1.75 a cup for the coffee they have in the lobby. There is no coffee in the rooms. If you're looking for a cheap dive to stay at---this is the place for you. Don't expect hot water in the shower either!

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: GabiLuna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to Kahului airport, Wailuku, and the Iao Valley. We found its location very convenient; we spent half a day visiting the Iao Needle and Wailuku before we started the road to hana trip the following day. Room was clean, spacious, and had a partial ocean view which we enjoyed a lot. Also, many places in the Kahului-Wailuku area require guests to stay for at least two or three nights and this hotel was a great option for us since we only wanted to spend one night in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for one night, airport transition”
Reviews.Author: 14Surprise
Reviews.Content: Like so many other reviewers, we chose to stay here for one night because our flight arrived late into Maui and we wanted our kids to experience the drive up the coast in the morning. I'm going to start off with the nice part because the rest of it is pretty downhill. We were pleasantly surprised by the morning breakfast near the rooftop pool. It was free, the staff was very nice and accomodating, the food was good. The environment was very nice. The rooms, not so much. The bed was hard, the bathroom had ants and I recall seeing a used washcloth from another guest hanging in the shower. There was a loud in-wall air conditioner to keep the temperature cool. I don't recall sleeping much! The other problem with this area is that there is nothing in the way of restaurants except for a Denny's, a Deli, and the mall for dining. If the mall is closed, you're in trouble. Everything is focused at the coast. However, by staying here the first night, we were able to go to Whole Foods in the morning and pick up lots of snacks for the week as well as go to the drug store and pick up beach toys. This was important for the kids and helped save us some money for the rest of the week. For this fact alone, I may....shutter to say, do this again...

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: cindywv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after having traveled to several locations around Maui. We wanted to be close to the airport since we had a morning flight. Our room totaled less than $125 and included breakfast. We faced a commercial highway with mountains in the distance. If this was my only room in Maui, I would have been disappointed. The room was very basic, but fine for one night or budget travelers. The hallways smelled like smoke. I looked forward to swimming in the pool but discovered that it is closed during and after dinner. I had time for a short swim- there were not available towels at the pool area. The pool adjoins the restaurant and I guess they do not want the noise to interfere with diners. It is on the roof of a balcony- so shielded from the street. Breakfast included hot and cold items and was fine. Hotel was close to several stores and chain restaurants but I do not think you could walk to them. Parking was free and easy.

Reviews.Title: “CHEAP BUT CLEAN! Easy access to stores. Please read THIS REVIEW”
Reviews.Author: 28april
Reviews.Content: Security 24/7 Cameras. Buffet dinners & breakfast. Rooms are simple it's true, not a resort but if your on a budget or need to be close to the airport it's perfect. Your on an island anyhow. How much time do you want to spend in a hotel? We moved here to Maui but are headed back to the Mainland. My husband went a week ahead of us. I checked in, ( cleaning the house it was easier by getting a hotel in town we lived in Kihei) then sudden pain :( the hotel took me to the ER. Staff & security watched my two boys 6-10. Till almost midnight. A customer service girl named Melissa was getting off work( lived in Kihei) but drove to pick me up first. They brought the kids toys & drinks. My husband kept in contact with all of is. But the hotel quizzed him like no other before letting him speak to the boys. I TRAVEL A LOT BUT HAVE NEVER SEEN A HOTEL GO THIS FAR AND BEYOND TO HELP!!! The pool is not fancy. Nor are the rooms but they work. Kids didn't complain. You can order movies& games on the TV as well. I'm forever grateful to this hotel. If you want a resort and a fancy place then don't forget your in Maui & if that's what you want. Expect to pay well over 200$ a night. Grand Wilea I once paid 600$!!!!! No joke. You get what you pay for. But you can't buy human genuine care. The Aloha Spirit but you get it here! April M Miller.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but excellent location, service and price”
Reviews.Author: Starnutzer
Reviews.Content: My friend and I go on an adventure every summer and chose Maui this year. We researched several hotels on the island but chose the Maui Beach Hotel based on price and location. The rooms were not fancy but were clean and had all of the basics as expected. We had a room that faced out towards the road but the view of the mountains was still very pretty. We always felt safe within the hotel and on the grounds. For two women traveling in unfamiliar territory that is a huge plus. The location was perfect as we were centrally located in the island so no matter where we were headed it seemed quick and easy to get there. It was 2 hours to Haleakala Crater, 40 min to Lahaina. There was also a Starbucks at the mall across the street which helped on those early mornings. When it was time to check out we were able to leave our bags at the hotel at 2:30am on our way to the crater for sunrise and then returned at 7pm to pick them up from the locked storage area before heading to the airport for our flight home. The staff were always helpful and prompt. The parking was great and we usually had close spaces available. Only once when they were hosting an event in e bar on Sat night did we have to park at the very far end of the lot. Overall, we viewed the hotel as a stopping point to grab some sleep in between different activities around the island and weren't looking for a romantic or especially fancy place. The building is older but does appear to be well maintained. For the price and location it was perfect and would stay here again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “One night on the way out, worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: Jammer06
Reviews.Content: We couldn't get our timeshare and our flights to line up perfectly so we had to spend a night in Kahului for a 10am flight out. Coming from the Kaanapali area it was nice to spend the last night much closer to the airport. The hotel itself seems like it's been recently refurbished although the tv's are still old. For $110 it wasn't bad plus it had free internet so we fired up the netflix to get the movies we wanted to see. Water pressure was nonexistent in the shower but other than that the grounds are well kept and the staff was friendly. All in all if you need to to do a night on the way in or out this was fine enough for that purpose. It would be hard to recommend staying a whole week or something without a kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience ever! Warning - Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: hmbcountryfan
Reviews.Content: The worst part wasn't that this hotel is a total dump, but the customer service is the worst I have ever encountered. The staff is not only un-professional, but rude. After a wonderful stay in a fabulous resort in Kaanapali, my 84-year old mother fell and was taken to the hospital up the street from the Maui Beach Hotel. The hospital social worker was kind enough to suggest this hotel, which was close to the hospital. I was not sure how many nights I would need the hotel, but from the hospital, called each day before 11:00 a.m. (their check-out deadline) to reserve the room for another night. By late in the evening, each night when returning to the hotel, I learned that my room was no longer available and I would have to relocate. This happened 3 times! Each time the hotel front-desk staff was rude and discourteous. Since the hospital food was not very good, I had purchased and stored a few items in the refrigerator in my room to take to my Mother, which were stolen by the housekeeping staff! When I complained, no apology or restitution was offered and the Manager would not return my calls. As a single woman, I never felt safe staying there. The parking lot was dimly lit and frequently occupied by people loitering late in the evening. The rooms were tacky and dirty. The bed was uncomfortable, the air-conditioner barely functioned and was noisy. The room smelled of mildew and the hallways reeked of cigarette smoke. I have never been more disappointed and disgusted with a stay in my life! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone - I had a horrible experience!

Reviews.Title: “You get less for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: honoapu
Reviews.Content: Did not get the best price for room and breakfast through the hotel but from an outside online booking site. Good: 1) We were able to check in a few hours before the specified check in time. 2) Free parking and lots of available parking that weekend 3) Paid $5 extra per person through price of room and the selections were nice - toast, belgium waffles, bacon, sausage, eggs, rice, coffee, juice, cold cereal, fruit. etc. 4) Small refrigerator in room 5) Convenient location to food, shopping, restaurants Not too good: 1) Very uncomfortable queen bed and the 2 pillow were horribly insignificant. First hotel I felt like going out and buying pillows. 2) Basic small, small room that felt really, really small. Is it worth it to upgrade? 3) Shower in fact a very terrible shower as the head was too high for short me and it was very small. 4) Amenities, basically industrial dispenser push button soap and shampoo in shower and by sink. 5) Noisy A/C and when we opened the windows it was very warm. 6) Uncomfortable sleep And this is suppose to be the better of the two Kahului hotels. Local news just announced Marriott Courtyard is building a Kahului hotel soon - I'll be there.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: station
Reviews.Content: Whilst the Maui Beach Hotel is not a new, it is clean and comfortable and has everything one could need. The rooms are on the small side, but this was not a problem during our stay. The bed was good quality, the staff were friendly, the breakfast has something for everyone and is reasonably priced. The hotel is within easy walking distance to shops and restaurants and there is a free shuttle to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service I've encountered any where”
Reviews.Author: Unsatisfiedcustomer2
Reviews.Content: We were sent to this hotel for an overnight by the WestJet agent in Kahului who gave us a confirmation number. She told us we would be given food vouchers by the hotel. When we checked in the front desk clerk told us we have no reservation, even after giving her the confirmation number, and told us we should go back to Westjet for clarification. At this point we were very tired as we havenâ€™t slept properly for two nights, and were very hungry having had no lunch yet, facts which I had clearly told the clerk who didnâ€™t seem to care. After a while, she finally sent us back to the airport at our expense to obtain some documentation which we were able to do and we were sent back to this hotel. We also learned that the agent has been in touch with the front desk clerk about our situation several times but the hotel wanted something in writing. This time the hotel sent a shuttle service. The front desk clerk tried to explain that somebody has to pay for our accommodation, blamed Westjet for the misunderstanding and offered some lame excuse. Being tired and hungry I asked for a dinner voucher but she gave us a breakfast voucher instead ignoring my advice that we couldnâ€™t use it due to a very early morning flight the next day. We assumed we could use this at their restaurant who subsequently refused it claiming it was only good for breakfast so we had to pay for it. When we confronted the desk clerk she confirmed it was indeed only for breakfast clearly ignoring our advice. When I reminded her that we asked for dinner vouchers she gave us a disgusted look! Needless to say, this set the tone for our Hawaii vacation. The way that we were treated especially by such employees who supposedly are part of the hospitality industry is unacceptable! Even the economic downturn is not a valid reason for such rude behavior!

Reviews.Title: “convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: kaz188
Reviews.Content: we only stayed here overnight as we couldn't book a 5th night at lahaina shores plus we had a 6am flight the next morning. normal check-in time is 4pm which i thought was 2 hours later than usual but they let us check in early. we were allocated a twin room right next to the road but we were so tired we didn't have any problems sleeping. within close proximity to queen ka'ahumanu center and 10mins from airport with free shuttle buses from 6am onwards. service at the front desk could have been better. there is a shop in the hotel which was closed for most of the day. there is free wired internet in the room but we didn't have a laptop. apparently, there is free wi-fi from the lobby but this required a password. we never bothered using it. if you're looking for a cheap hotel near the airport, this is the one. but i wouldn't recommend staying here for longer than 2 nights. spend the extra $$ and stay in lahaina shores beach resort or around kihei.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for money spent”
Reviews.Author: rq802a
Reviews.Content: Very clean room. Located close to airport, mall and quiet/private location. A distance from popular Lahaina Harbor but you can take a bus there for $1.00/each person. The gals in the lobby could be friendlier and warmer when greeting guests. (Hard wired) internet in the room is not reliable, working intermittently. Overall, it's not bad for money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Last flight off Maui left without me,Hotel gave me safety over night.”
Reviews.Author: hoolehua
Reviews.Content: Last minute(usually you need to make reservations first)...walk in and treated warmly.Also,drove me to airport next morning on shuttle,FREE....Love this place would use again:)

Reviews.Title: “Blissful”
Reviews.Author: glocal-citizen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in December, 2010. The amazing part of the stay was the stretch of beach within the hotel premises. It was wonderful, quiet and private. It is near a large shopping complex- Kahumaanu shopping complex (across the road) and near the airport too. The pool was well-maintained. The restaurant could offer more variety in their dinner and lunch menu. Their breakfast menu is wonderful (a sumptuous buffet). Internet connection was good. Housekeeping was excellent! I would recommend this hotel- affordable, clean and elegant with your own private beach!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: traumadiver
Reviews.Content: Quick review of my one night stay at this hotel. The room was clean. I got a room overlooking the beach on the ground floor. Nice view, especially as the sun was rising and I saw the stand up paddleboarders and a Matson ship docking up. The service was good. No issues. Would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor room”
Reviews.Author: bdwood2000
Reviews.Content: We were there for one night, the location is close to the airport and local shopping and restaurants. The room was close to traffic, very stuffy and the bed was not comfortable. Probably would not go back. I was expecting and hoping for more.

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I have ever received in my life”
Reviews.Author: M_R_27_1
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel for the last couple of days of our vacation, as it is one of the two places available in Kahului. Upon check-in, they made us wait around for four hours, since the rooms were not available. The receptionist was extremely rude, and wouldn't let us know when the room would be available (she kept saying 3, 3:30, 4, 4:30). It was finally available at 4:30. Talking to other travelers, apparently we weren't the only people facing this situation. The rooms are relatively clean - clean enough for a two or three-star hotel. The shower light wouldn't work, and they said they don't have personnel to come fix it for us. The wireless wasn't available on the second floor, and the ethernet cable wasn't working. After I complained, they told me they would not renew my stay for the following night, if I "keep complaining"... I have travelled all over the world, and stayed at no-star to 5-star hotels, and this has been the poorest service I have ever received in my life. I do not recommend this place, if you want to have a stress-free vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet”
Reviews.Author: ichabod66604
Reviews.Content: just want to tell people about the good, casual Japanese buffet. Plenty of choices, good quality. Older hotel and restaurant. Nothing fancy. It is convenient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location, good deal”
Reviews.Author: Tiagogo
Reviews.Content: I found the Maui Beach Hotel by accident and glad I did. It's a nice hotel right near the airport, a major shopping, and it's convenient to many sightseeing locations in Maui -- including Paia, Hana, Iao Valley, and Maalaea. The special at the time was $99/night which included breakfast for two people. The room was up-to-date and comfy. It had a fridge and safe... but no coffee maker. Another plus is that parking is free. Downsides: - Room size -- it was a pretty small room. But since I didn't come to Maui to hang out in my room, I didn't mind too much. But after two nights, I was ready for something bigger. - Service is pretty slow. I remember when I was checking in wondering why the man was taking so long to give me a room. I was content during my stay at the Maui Beach but after two nights, I was ready to move on to a resort.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: rolncathy
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews and wasn't sure what to expect, but.... It definitely wasn't a resort, but doesn't claim to be. We were finishing a week stay in Maui and wanted a place near the airport. This enabled us to turn in our car a day early and have a day to unwind before heading home. The open air lobby was pleasant with tables and seating inside or out on a patio. The center of the large U-shaped building was grass, trees and flowers, opening on to the harbor. The swimming pool is on the second floor just outside the restaurant, thus it closes early - 5:30 pm. It was clean and unused, except by us. The beach in front of the hotel was rocky, but a short walk to the right brought us to a sandy beach, which we didn't use, but others did. We walked along the beach toward the cruise ship that was in port and also out to the jetty where we talked to local fishermen and watched sea turtles in the water. We ate two meals at the hotel. Dinner was the fanciest we ate on our trip, though some nights are buffet style. It changes by the night. There were a lot of choices at the breakfast buffet. Our room faced the open grass area and the harbor and was very quiet. The second floor had a lanai, we were on the first floor. There was a small refrigerator in the room, no microwave. There were two shopping centers within easy walking distance, but our suitcases were full so we skipped that. Free airport transportation by a very friendly driver was a definite plus. It was a pleasant end to a lovely vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Only good for one night if you need to catch a flight”
Reviews.Author: ita360
Reviews.Content: Overall it is one of only 2 hotels by the airport. Seemed clean although odd smell. Beds are a little tired. Close to airport. I would only suggest staying here on your way to/from airport. Since there is only one road from the west coast to the airport it is too risky (there were fires that shut down the road when we were there) to stay at any of the resorts. Note! The shuttle only runs until 9pm and only runs on the half hour. Front desk staff is apparently unaware of this. We left the hotel at around 9pm to drop off the rental car so we wouldn't have to deal with it the morning of the flight. Asked front desk if the shuttle could pick us up as we were dropping off the car. They said sure just call us. When we called from the rental drop off they informed us the shuttle stopped at 9pm! We left the hotel and asked the front desk at around 8:55pm! We were not happy at all with that. The hotel staff should know when the shuttle stops running. Couldn't find a cab as all the flights had landed for the night. A very nice policeman called a cab for us and waited with us. After 30min and no cab he saw a friend of his who worked at the airport and was also a cabbie. He gave us a ride to the hotel and didn't even charge us!!! A very sweet man and a good end to a frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful during a trying situation”
Reviews.Author: CLWFLA
Reviews.Content: We were driving back to our hotel in West Maui after spending the day driving the road to Hana when we hit a road closure due to brushfires. A restaurant across the street suggested we stay at the hotel as it was evening and no one was sure when the highway would reopen. As you can imagine, we were tired and not too happy about this. The hotel offered us a special discounted rate for our troubles and gave us a nice room! I've seen where hotels have raised their rates given a similar situation, so Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Hula2
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel, it is a bit expensive for what you get. They charge additional for each person over two people staying in the room. Showers small, not sure that a large person would fit! Clean rooms. Haridryer in bathroom area. Would stay there again for price and central location on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the night before a flight”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie526
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Beach Hotel on the night before an early flight. It's a no frills kinda place, but perfect proximity to the airport and the shuttle is great. The room was small and simple. It was very clean and everything in the bathroom seemed new. It had all the basics-- hairdryer, ironing board and toiletries (in dispensers-- yay for their efforts to go green!) The staff were all very friendly and check-in and check-out both went quickly. The snack store was really convenient and had pretty good variety. The "beach" isn't much but it's a good view. I wouldn't recommend this place for a whole week in Maui but it's perfect for the night before a flight out of Kahului.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a "Budget" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZenkenJen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when we got stuck at the Maui airport. They offer a shuttle and a mediocre room at a decent rate. I would not want to spend my entire Maui vacation here. The rooms are dated, while the bathrooms appear to have been recently remodeled. Or, at least the one was in the room I stayed. Hotel staff is friendly and accomodating. Did not use the pool. Largely was there for a bed and free internet--- which is about what it's good for! I would only recommend this hotel as a stop-over point, not as a vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “Pool faces the road, not the ocean :(”
Reviews.Author: nikitangel
Reviews.Content: We ended up at the Maui Beach Hotel because it was near the airport and had a shuttle, and we'd just been bumped from our flight. Unfortunately, the shuttle stopped at 9pm, so we had to pay for a taxi there anyway. Check-in was fast and easy and our room was adequate. The TV is pretty small, but I appreciated having a mini-fridge right in the room. The shower accessories are in containers attached to the wall, so you can't take any leftovers home with you, which is a little disappointing. We never got the wake-up call we ordered, but luckily woke up naturally in time for our flight. The internet was free and much appreciated, although it's a land-line that you have to drag across the room if you're sitting on the bed. The pool took me awhile to find - it's on the second floor, and facing the (noisy) road. With such a gorgeous ocean view on the other side of the building, I can't understand why they would put the pool there. Plus, you have to walk through the dining room to get to it. It was decent enough, but could use some shade. I just wanted to read next to the pool, and I had to be in the sun the whole time. They have a nice little outdoor lounge area next to the lobby, but it's recessed into the yard, meaning you cannot see the ocean while sitting down. This seems silly to me, since there is plenty of room and grassy lawn in front of that area. We liked being able to buy candy in the snack shop, but I wish it had been open all day. The vending machines had soda only. We walked over to the mall for breakfast at Rubyâ€™s Diner, since the hotel stops serving at 9:30 (seems early for people on vacation!). The fencing on the hotel property meant we had to walk entirely across the lot and back to get around, which felt silly, but we didnâ€™t want to climb the fence. Still, breakfast was great. We made our reservations for the airport shuttle and caught it with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bgrs2go
Reviews.Content: Bummed along on my boyfriends business trip due to it was in Maui. Hotel is close to the airport. I have nevered stayed on this side of Maui before. The hotel is clean with no frills. Bar & food stop at 8:30, way to early, but no one really stays at this hotel but locals for business. I was alway out enjoying the island on the other side, so actually the hotel was just fine, clean and a nice quite place to sleep. So for the price it worked out well.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean hotel near the airport and Maui War Memorial Stadium”
Reviews.Author: 0puns
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight to coach a Pop-Warner football game at Maui War Memorial Stadium. The Maui Beach is about a five minute drive from the Kahului airport and very easy to find. Check-in was ultra quick and I was allowed to check-in an hour early. Parking is not only ample, but free. Upon seeing the room (#131), I was pleasantly surprised. The bathroom had been recently renovated and although the shower (no tub) and toilet are in close quarters, the sink and mirror area is very roomy. The air-conditioner was reliable and kept my room cool. There is a decent sized refrigerator and the cable T.V. had numerous channels. The beds weren't perfect, but I still slept soundly. Even though there were kids throughout the hotel, I couldn't hear any of them. The bottom line is the Maui Beach is clean, the service friendly, and the price reasonable. Considering the fact that the airport, the Queen Kahumanu Mall, and Maui War Memorial Stadium are all within a 5 minute drive away from the hotel, it's almost a no brainer to choose the Maui Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Modest accommodations, good for an overnight stay only.”
Reviews.Author: JTears
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister for one night. The reason was that my flight was arriving in Kahului very late and it was one of the closest hotels to the airport offering budget accommodations. Overall, it was as another reviewer stated earlier, "You get what you pay for." Check-in was quick and efficient. Because I booked through the website, I had prepaid my stay so there was no need for any additional paperwork. I believe motel would be a more appropriate description, as the decor throughout is extremely spartan. Hotel hallways are on the interiors, but the lighting is harsh overhead fluorescent bulbs. Note that although this is a two story structure, there is no convenient elevator to speak of, so if you have a lot of luggage, you must haul it up a pretty long flight of stairs. The room itself was basic, but comfortable. Again, motel-like with somewhat soft mattresses, cotton-poly blend sheets, and poly bed covers. The small bathroom also was simple, but recently remodeled. The tiny shower had pumps providing shower gel and combined shampoo and conditioner. Climate control was provided by a wall mounted air conditioner, which made it very difficult to adjust the room temperature (it was either too cold with it on or stuff and warm with it off). The room itself was quiet, but I think that was a factor of very few guests staying at the hotel. The few from the room looked out over the hotel's interior courtyard and onto the adjacent Kahului Bay. There is no real beach to speak of in terms of white sands and activity access. Overall it was as I expected: nothing wonderful, but nothing terrible. The hotel itself is very conveniently located to the main business districts of Kahului and Wailuku, so if you do have a late flight, you can stock up on supplies before heading off to further flung destinations. This was particularly convenient because I was headed for a two night stay in Hana and wanted to pick up some goods for my journey. Also, there are plenty of great local places to eat within a mile of the hotel, places that are not the usual tourist traps like Bubba Gump's or Cheeseburger in Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you PAY FOR...”
Reviews.Author: EzekielStone
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very big dissapointment. The FD was very rude and "PREOCCUPIED" doing nothing. No customer service at all. The elevator smelt like a dumpster was near by and the rooms were very poor. We asked about a late-check out as our flight was not til late in the evening and with out hesitation the agent said "One-Nights Charge". She didnt even offer to store our bags. I asked about restaurants aound the area and she pointed me to ask the BELLMAN. Very sad, rude, old lady. Becuase of the service we received from the get go upon c/o we just droppped our keys into the "QUICK CHECK-OUT" slot at the FD. Now I know why they provide this service. Only good things were the free Parking & Internet. I will not recommend this hotel, nor will I return. I highly recommend staying in Kihei or Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but location is on windy side and from anything”
Reviews.Author: arkguy42
Reviews.Content: This hotel would probably be fine if you have a car. You have to ride a bus into Lahaina, which is rather inconvenient. There are two malls witinin walking distance, and several fine restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk unfriendly and rude!”
Reviews.Author: Island_boy1_9
Reviews.Content: Front desk was not helpful at all with a minor problem I had with the room. I would not recommend Maui Beach Hotel to anyone. Also the front hung up on me! They SUCK!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: JudyWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 10 nights and found the hotel to be equivalent to most three star hotels we've stayed at. I saw no worn or shabby areas and there were no bad smells or dirty areas. We had almost cancelled reading the negative reviews but found them to be untrue. We used the reastaurant and bar and found all the staff were especially nice and the food excellent. Both the buffets and the bar pupu platters were always good. We didn't care about the pool so it's odd location by the dining room didn't bother us. Our room had a stainless hand held shower an unusual and very nice feature. The only negative was that this hotel doesn't offer complimentary (Or for sale) coffee --a first for us. Judy G. from Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: JeanMars
Reviews.Content: We didn't enjoy our stay at Maui Beach hotel; first we requested the lobby for a *calm* room. When arriving to the room, it was very noisy due to the road quite close and the poor sound insulation. So we changed for a room at $150. This one was acceptable for the noise. However it was a very simple room you can expect at a very lowest price (~$70) : furniture are very simple and room small. No charm, no envy to extend our stay here. The only interest is that this hotel is close to the beach and the airport. I guess this is one hotel among thousands relying on these two weak interests to attract tourists that choose simplicity.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a good way to start a trip to Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: s_sandn
Reviews.Content: ~Despite our late arrival, our room was not ready for us. ~When we were eventually given a room, we were somewhat surprised to discover that the bathroom had no door on it. Not only was there no door, but the toilet was fully visible from the outside door to the room. We didn't realize what a inconvenience this would be until I left the room for ice and had to wait until my husband had finished using the bathroom to re-enter the room. ~After one use of the toilet, it backed up and despite our calls to the front desk for maintenance, it remained unusable for the duration of our stay. ~The carpeting in the room was filthy -- sticky to the touch and I was disgusted to find the bottoms of my feet were blackened after walking across the floor just enough to move our suitcases from near the door to a location nearer the bed. Needless to say, I, my husband, and my son wore our shoes for the remainder of our stay. ~Our room was described as having a queen-sized bed. Since our bed at home is queen-sized, we were unpleasantly surprised to discover that my husband was unable to stretch out on the bed without his feet dangling off the end. At 6"1", a standard queen sized bed should be more than adequate in length to support him comfortably while sleeping. ~Our frustrations and criticisms of the room upon check-out were met with a response of "Well, that's your opinion." ~All in all, a thoroughly unpleasant experience. We certainly would not stay there again, nor would we recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Travellorr
Reviews.Content: Arriving in the early evening in Maui, as most planes do, we wanted a place to stay near the airport. We were pleasantly surprised by the Seaside. It was reasonable (for Maui standards in February, $185), it was clean, it was comfortable. Folks at the front desk are a bit stingy with a smile at first, but work them a bit and they loosen up. By the time you arrive and check in you'll probably be pretty tired, so check out a restaurant called MaÃ±ana Garage which is just across the street from the Seaside, serves great blended margaritas and TexMex-inspired food. They were very friendly to us tired travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: Dottybug
Reviews.Content: Our group of two adults and two children stayed at the Maui Beach Hotel from Dec. 27-29, 2007. This hotel has a very friendly staff and I heard it's a place where Hawaii residents often stay. It isn't a 5-star hotel but it's clean and comfortable, and we had very good service. We had trouble with our car rental and the bell desk clerk was nice enough to offer to drive us to the airport to get the problem fixed. When we requested extra towels, they arrived within 5 minutes. We were always greeted with smiles and friendly hellos when passing by staff members. We were warned not to swim at the beach that the hotel is on because the cruise ship docks nearby so the water is not clean enough to swim in. They do have a decent sized pool on the 2nd floor, but you need to bring towels from your room. It is very conveniently located 10 minutes from Kahului airport, and is also convenient as a starting point for sightseeing around the island. The rooms are not very big, but we had enough space to plop our two large suitcases without tripping over them. The laundromat downstairs has 3 washers and 3 dryers, and a detergent dispenser - don't forget to bring quarters. My only complaint would be that once after flushing the toilet, the tank didn't fill up so it ran for about 10 minutes before we realized it. Just a jiggle of the handle fixed the problem, so it was a minor detail, but it could've meant a big water loss if we had left the room without noticing it. But that was the only thing that concerned me during our stay. It was a nice place to rest our heads, and we would recommend the Maui Beach Hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst hotel ever, but...”
Reviews.Author: elirnerak
Reviews.Content: This is not the worst hotel we've ever stayed in, but it had quite a few problems. First of all, it is nowhere near the beach. This was not a problem for us because we'd rented a car, but anyone staying here should realize that a car rental is a must. The hotel is located on a highway in an industrial/retail area. The staff was not helpful when we asked them for suggestions of where to visit, so I will mention here that the charming plantation town of Pa'ai is a 15 minute drive, back past the airport. Just before Pa'ai is the Baldwin State Beach, a lifeguarded swimming beach with exciting (i.e., rough) surf. Hookipa Beach, a famous windsurfing beach, is a bit further down the road. The northern Maui beaches, near the bigger resorts, are accessible to the public. You need to drive about 45 minutes and find on-street parking, but this was also not a problem with a decent map. As for the hotel itself, when we arrived their key card machine was broken, so we needed to be escorted to our rooms every time we wanted to enter. A day later the machine was fixed. You need a card to access the hotel rooms-- yet the back door to the hotel was continually propped open to the parking lot with an orange traffic cone! Our room was clean enough, but some others in our party had complaints about the cleanliness of linens . The hotel has a pool, but it is only open from 9-5 because, apparently, you need to walk through the restaurant to get to the pool. Because we were gone all day we never saw the restaurant or the pool. There is no coffee machine in the room and the lobby coffee shop/snack bar opens at the peculiar hour of 9 AM, so we drove elsewhere for coffee and breakfast. If we return to Maui we will take a wide berth around this hotel. True, it is close to the airport, but the island is so small that it does not seem to be a particular advantage to stay close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “ok if you don't want to spend much time at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: vkneidow
Reviews.Content: service: room service ok - only receptionist a little slow and non-cooperative room: our room was very small - there was basically 20 inches on 3 sides around the bed. the closet was tiny, bathroom ok. location: no beach (next to the harbor!), you will definitely have to go somewhere else! very close to the airport (5 minutes) but no noise, so this is ok. if you want to get to the west beaches, do not attempt to take the north road (its forbidden with rental cars anyways, and you will definitely get motion-sick!). for us, the location was ok, as we had a rental car and wanted to do some island exploring anyhow. on our first morning, we used our jetlag at got up at 3am to watch sunrise at haleakala. leaving kahului at 3 is fine (at least in december) - make sure to bring VERY warm clothes. it is MIGHTY cold up there! do NOT book a mountainbike tour downhill - this must be the most moring thing ever, as 1000 bikers to the tour every day and start in groups of 20 about 1 minute apart from each other. do some hiking in the moon-like landscape but TAKE IT EASY! there's not a lot of oxygen up there!!! the road to hana (including many side-hikes) is fabulous, also Lahaina and almost all the beaches on the west coast. we played golf at the bay cours in kapalua - much cheaper than the plantation course and definitely worth the price if you get a afternoon -rate. we managed to come in just before sunset - it was fabulous. ladies - if possible bring your own clubs as they do only have mens and steel shafts... we had dinner at the pinapple grill - it was amazing... one of the best place I have eaten at outside of europe! if you are looking for a great travel giude book buy the lonely planet - it advises on great beaches that really and this is not joke NO ONE except for some natives seems to know...we were at this fantastic beach close to lahaina that yoiu cannot see from the road (cannot remember the name!) - quite, very nice sand, bathroom, good snorkeling, AND we got to see (and hear) a WHALE!

Reviews.Title: “nice cozy maui beach hotel--I LOVED IT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: samanne05
Reviews.Content: THIS HOTEL WAS AMAZING!! My fiance was a little hesitant at taking me here but I loved it. GREAT SERVICE, SMILING AND COURTEOUS STAFF. Nice, cozy little hotel, kind of open, I could really relax there. It's close to the harbor where Norwegian Cruiseline comes in. I didn't get to tour the hotel because of my schedule but I heard the pool was amazing!!! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Down the street from lots of shopping (2 MALLS).

Reviews.Title: “If you have options, stay somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: Shaney G
Reviews.Content: Pros: Central Location, Plenty of FREE parking & Bell Desk Service Cons: Front Desk Service, Rooms in General, Over Priced Rates & Noisy Air Conditioning. There's no denying that this is an ideal location to the airport and a great starting point to tour both sides of the Island. But other than that, everything else is just below average. With no real competition, other than the Maui Seaside, this property displays the "take it or leave it" mentality. The front desk staff always seems busy doing something else and never shows that they really want to help you or care for that matter. The room that we stayed in, Room 139, facing the grass, was a recently renovated room with new paint on the walls and new shower paneling. However, the shower was barely big enough for an adult. The furniture was tacky tropical furniture from the 70's, that has seen better days. Believe it or not, renovations are still going on, so if you do decide to stay here please check with the hotel when booking this property. This property would be comparable to a Days Inn or Motel 6, but you don't pay the same comparable room rates as those national chains. I paid $110 a night for this room, that I probably would be paying about $69 at Days Inn. If you have options, stay somewhere else...SGS 050707

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch is their Speciality.....”
Reviews.Author: glen49
Reviews.Content: Bait and switch is their speciality and if you are in a pinch, they could care less. Not locally owned, but by a external firm which translates to poor serivice, lousy attitudes, money grabbing, standard to poor rooms and a terrible value, spend the time/money and stay somewhere else even if you are just passing through...

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: NANNYAlberta
Reviews.Content: I must say I expected a bit more from this hotel. Most hotels offer coffee machines in room but this one didn't and to make matters worse is their restaurant is only open for early breakfast until 9a.m. I believe and not again until 5.30 or so for dinner and closed at I believe 7 p.m. They only offered buffet style food and quite overpriced for what they served. They also seem to cater to asian cuisine more so than having american choices. The bathroom floors had hair not removed from the previous guest and the same piece's of hair were still there after three days of maid service. The pool closed at 5 p.m. daily which was another turnoff. I received a fax which they charged me $4.50 for two pages . Some gouging there if you ask me. I wouldn't go there again

Reviews.Title: “There is a Pool!”
Reviews.Author: bfson
Reviews.Content: After seeing some of the horrible reviews at TripAdvisor I was expecting a horrible stay. It was better than that. First, there is a pool (I swam in it) It's on the scond floor between the restaurant and the street. It closes at 5pm so they can set up the restaurant. Second, the room was clean but worn and spartan. Good AC. Friendly staff. This is NOT a resort but an older business hotel. Since I was there on business and did not spend much time in the room, it was fine. I would go back for business or a very cheap vacation. The hotel sits on two noisy streets so ask for a room facing the inner lawn area (and you will have a view of the harbor) as it turned out I was in one of the handicapped rooms and it had a large shower. I can't comment on what a standard room has in that regard.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Beach is Central”
Reviews.Author: CINNER
Reviews.Content: We needed a good priced hotel and this is it. You get what you pay for its not an unscale hotel but its near the airport and everything is central. The only problem is there is no pool. I don't know what happend to it. All in all Maui Beach Hotel is just perfect for a low budget stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably bad . . . what pool?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only possible thing I can think after reading all these reviews is that this hotel has gone downhill fast since they were written. Even though they were a little old, we felt that there was probably enough truth to the reviews that the Maui Beach Hotel would be at least an "ok" place to stay on our pass through to the Big Island and then again on the way to Oahu. We couldn't have been more wrong. It was so un-ok that we cancelled our second night stay even though it would have been just to sleep and catch an early flight. First of all, the pictures were very misleading. Pool? What pool? If there ever was one, it was gone by the time we stayed there in October! Why would they still show it in their ads? Though the room was clean, there was a party all night long, both in the corridor and in the room next door, and it made for a very difficult night's sleep. Staff was very hesitant to break up the party, and the hotel felt unsafe enough that my husband was hesitant to stick his head out the door to ask them to quiet down. Perhaps it was the appearance of the lobby, with what looked liked drug addicts and bums loitering around that made us uncomfortable. Despite this, when my husband finally gave up on sleep, he went to the lobby to try to use his laptop and he was greeted by staff fighting with each other and screaming at each other behind the front desk. He was told that the wireless access was not for guest use, but that he could use it anyway, and then he was told by someone else ( security maybe? ) that he couldn't. Too bad security wasn't more worried about the shady characters hanging about in the halls and the lobby. Not to worry, though, because by the time our friend went looking for us in the lobby ( husband was back in the room ) the police had arrived on scene. Fantastic! We knew this would not be an upscale hotel, but regardless of the price, still would like to have felt safe and comfortable. Everything about this place, including the neighborhood, felt seedy. We would rather have driven a little farther to get to the airport than to have felt as uncomfortable as we were. We could not get out of there soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “OK budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: fxdacat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maui Beach Hotel for 4 nights. Overall it was an average hotel experience. No major frills but it was clean and the location was good. It's a good hotel if you just need to a home base and plan on going around the island during the day. Positives: - Clean - Cheap ($100 per night) - Close to Kahului Airport (about 5 miles). At first I was concerned that we'd be hearing airplanes all the time but didn't hear one. - Close to some shopping centers (Safeway, drug store, Costco, fast food restaurants) - Restaurant/bar in the hotel (though we didn't eat there) - Convenience store in the hotel - Free shuttle to the airport - Enough free parking Negatives: - Not really the beach/resort atmosphere. - One day we found out that there was actually a beach area behind the hotel (guess that's why they call it Maui "Beach" Hotel). One night we had nothing to do and decided to check out the beach. This was around 10pm. We asked the lady at the front desk how we could get to the beach and she directed us to a door that accesses the beach and then to our surprise said something like "It's pitch dark out there. So be careful because the neighbor is not exactly... you know..." We did dared to go out and just found that the beach was a little sandy area right on an industrial lake/harbor. We didn't get jumped and I did feel safe during my entire stay but I just felt that the hotel lady's advice was striking.

Reviews.Title: “maui beach hotel a decent place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read a few reviews before we came to maui about this hotel,one decent one not so good. We werent sure what to expect when we arrived, my wife said she just wanted a decent clean room and thats what we got. I was happy with it ,the staff was good the room was clean, we slept and showered there then went out to enjoy maui.If your looking for a place to do this,the maui beach is a good place to stay, if your looking for a resort dont stay here.the prices for food and other things in kahalui werent as high as i thought they were going to be.maui on a budget? stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: JenRen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok but does not look like the pictures on the internet. The building is very old. It kind of feels like a prison with all the locked doors that you have to slide a card through to go through each hallway. The hallways smell like lysol. The room was nice and clean. The furniture seemed newer. The shower and toilet area was old and very dark. The snack bar and shop are pretty small and minimal. The front desk was very nice and helpful. This hotel is close to the airport and within walking distance of a lot of shopping areas. You have to drive though if you want to go to any swimming beaches.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST IN MAUI”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Maui Beach has unsurpassed my expectation. There is no words that can explain what a wonderful place this hotel is. I liked the fact that they are always there at their customers every need. The service was excellent and the rooms superb. The staffs here are very helpful and keep there guest at a number one priority. The residents here are also friendly. Maui is such a beautiful and historical place. I was so pleased with the way that Maui Beach handled them-selves, in such a professional manner. Maui Beach is located in the heart of maui and is in walking distance to everything. I plan on returning to maui soon and definately consider returning to Maui Beach. +*+*+*+*+*+*+ALOHA+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel For Your Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean and neat. Great view, exellent service, nice soap, just all around exellent.. Would stay there again.. more then I expected for the price I pid.. really had ALOHA

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there one night this summer because our flight came in at 9:00 p.m. and we were departing for Kauai at 10 the next morning. My stay there was a pleasant one because I didn't go there expecting a 'resort' atmosphere or amenities.. For around $70-$90, expect a small but comfortable and clean room close to the airport. The rooms are definitely NOT resort quality rooms. If you plan to stay there; keep in mind that the rooms are budget minded, no frills rooms. This would be a hotel which you would stay if you have a early flight out or use to pretty much strictly shower and sleep while on vacation. The people working at the hotel were wonderful and very nice. The beach in back of the hotel is definitely NOT a swimming beach, NOR is it one for romantic strolls during sunrise/sunset. It is actually a harbor and there appeared to be some homeless or squatter camps in the bushes to the right and the aftermath of several parties at the left of the beach next to the road. Anyways...there are so many other beaches to visit and explore on the island. The best thing about this hotel is the value and free shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Lizards are good luck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In response to the previous review-- Anyone coming to Maui may encounter "LIZARDS" they are called "GECKO'S" here, and are actually a sign of good luck. They eat pesky night flying bugs and are totally harmless. They probably occur at even the Grand Wailea, so please think of them as a positive thing instead of a negative. Aloha, enjoy your stay in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “lizard in my room,on my purse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I expected that a hotel rated 3 stars to be at least like 2 stars hotels from America.But-big disappointment! The hotel is 3 stars maybe for the '60 years! The rooms aren't so spacios as it is seen on the internet,the furniture and the carpet seem old,so seems the air conditioning device,too. There is only shower (those rooms with bath tub are deluxe,so more expensive!!),no cofee maker- things that usually exist in hotels not very expensive in America. And the worst thing - was a LIZARD in my room,on my purse!! And the stuff laughed when we asked for somebody to come to remove him!!Nobody said sorry,nobody apologised. And their presentation was very unrealistic,there was no beach good for swimming around,the hotel is on the bay,the port is nearby. Maybe I would have liked the hotel more if I had read the truth in their advertisment.

Reviews.Title: “Is this renovated?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This "renovated" hotel was truly a disappointment. Live termites on the curtains, in the windows, in the bed sheets and in the shower were unacceptable. The chain on the door was broken and there were beverages left in the refrigerator from a previous guest. The final disappointment was when the toilet over-flowed. The proximity to the airport and shopping centers was not worth the price of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for budget minded”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Maui Beach Motel does not boast white sandy beaches, but they do have a lovely large green courtyard area with a big pool and oceanfront view. Great spot to kick back and relax before or after your days outing. The rooms are your standard motel fare, as is the restaurant and bar. Clean and sufficient for travellers to Maui who aren't going to spend a lot of time in their rooms. The best part about this motel is it's location and price. Within walking distance (or a very short drive) of shops, restaurants and a cinema, this motel is located minutes from the airport and is so central on the island that everything is within a short one hour drive or less! (with the exception of Hana). We got a garden level room for $70/night. For the price and location you can't beat this motel if you are budget minded.
